body: If the `har-to-k6` tool will be the recommended tool, the docs https://docs.k6.io/docs/session-recording-har-support should also be updated.

issue.title: POST request with multipart/form-data missing in HAR conversion

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
I was recording a session in Chrome and converting the HAR to JS using K6 and found that one crucial request was missing from my script I simplified it down for you to test:
https://gist.github.com/Sam7/a267e875d77981254fd2a206070c58cd

The request just get's completely ignored and is not showing up on the JS file file 

This is the command I used:
`k6 convert .\xxx.zoo.org.au_simplified.har -O xxx.zoo.org.au_simplified.js`
Even verbose doesn't give me any more insight about what's going wrong.

Thanks.

issue.body:
"k6 convert" should emit a warning and point user to https://github.com/loadimpact/har-to-k6

Fixes #1124

issue.title: Ability for HAR convert to filter by substrings from the entire URL

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
According to the source of convert.go, the HAR converter currently supports the filters `only` and `skip` that only accept a domain string.

It would be cool if the converter could also filter by substrings (maybe regex even) from the entire URL - i.e. parsing the domain, the path and the query. JMeter, for instance, supports this in its Script Recorder.

For example, something like:
`k6 convert --only .*.jsp.* --skip .*ads\..*,.*analysics.js.* myfile.har` with regex or
`k6 convert --only .jsp --skip ads.,analysics.js myfile.har` for substring matches.

body: I reopen this as it was *long time ago* reverted with https://github.com/grafana/k6/pull/1268

I am of the opinion that the rational back then was that the lacking functionality was somehow particularly useful and we can't remove it without it.

Given that at least some of the features are still *not* implemented 2 years+ later - they likely won't be.

I would also argue that given that we haven't fixed anything around the har converter all this time -and haven't gotten any more reports - it is either not used or is perfect. The later seems unlikely.


I would propose that we:
1. Mark is a deprecated (this issue).
2. Wait for few releases - we can do as many as we want but I would argue more then 2 less than 6. So let's say the maximum 5 releases.
3.1 If there is feedback that this is used and is needed  and [har-to-k6](https://github.com/grafana/har-to-k6/) does not work well enough for this uses case. We would have good arguments for the changes in har-to-k6.
3.2. If there isn't any feedback - it is very likely this just isn't used. In which case after those releases we drop in the next one.
4. We can always make `k6 convert` into its own tool that has the same code but isn't part of k6 if it turns out there is interest.

issue.title: Drop the deprecated convert command

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: for PRs that need to be mentioned in the breaking changes section of the release notes

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
## What?

It drops the har converter as we decided in https://github.com/grafana/k6/issues/1124, and it is following the deprecation process started by https://github.com/grafana/k6/pull/2714.

https://github.com/grafana/har-to-k6 is the alternative
